translated: The Elders’ Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Bandhujīvaka
The Story of Elder Mandāravapupphapujaka🔽“Having been a god,
I worshipped the Leader, the Buddha,
And offered it to the Buddha.
For seven days there was a canopy,
A divine garland on the Realised One;
And worshipped the Realised One.🔽In the past, twenty-one eons ago,
I do not know of a bad destination,
This is the result of worshipping the Buddha.
And in the tenth past eon,
I was a king called Jutindhara,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the elder Mandāravapupphapujaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā mandāravapupphapūjako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Mandāravapupphapūjakattherassāpadānaṁ pañcamaṁ.
